title: KAWASANKU | DOSM
description1: How does my area shape up against other areas? What are its demographics? What are labour conditions like? Does it have adequate public services? It is DOSM's mission to bring the answers to these questions to the rakyat's fingertips.
description2: Following the completion of Population and Housing Census of Malaysia 2020 (MyCensus 2020), DOSM released population data at Parliament Constituency and State Legislative Assembly level for the first time in history. The Kawasanku dashboard is intended to give citizens, policymakers, and the international community an accessible way to explore the dataset.
section2_title1: A comparison of key variables across states

jitterplot.dislaimer: Note: Dispersions across variables are not intended to be perfectly comparable

metric_2.label: Maximum elevation
metric_2.tooltip: Topobathy data was derived from the freely available Global Multi-resolution Terrain Elevation Data 2010 (GMTED2010) dataset, at 7.5 arc-second resolution. Geospatial analysis was conducted by DOSM.

metric_3.label: Terrain Ruggedness Index
metric_3.tooltip: Terrain ruggedness indicates how jagged or flat an area is, on average. TRI was computed following Riley et al. (1999), using the freely available GMTED2010 dataset at 30 arc-second resolution. Geospatial analysis was conducted by DOSM.

metric_4.label: Surface covered in water
metric_4.tooltip: Water cover data was derived from EC JRC and Google's freely available Global Surface Water dataset under the Copernicus Programme (Pekel et al., 2016). Geospatial analysis was conducted by DOSM.

metric_5.label: Surface covered in forest
metric_5.tooltip: Tree cover data was derived from UMD, Google, USGS and NASA's freely available Global Forest Change dataset (Hansen et al., 2013). Geospatial analysis was conducted by DOSM.

metric_6.label: Forest loss between 2000 to 2021
metric_6.tooltip: Tree loss data was derived from UMD, Google, USGS and NASA's freely available Global Forest Change dataset (Hansen et al., 2013). Geospatial analysis was conducted by DOSM.

metric_7.label: Intensity of lights at night
metric_7.tooltip: Night lights intensity data was derived from the freely available global VIIRS Nighttime Light dataset (Elvidge et al., 2020). Geospatial analysis was conducted by DOSM.

metric_13.label: Young-age dependency ratio
metric_13.tooltip: Ratio of young-age (0-14) to working age (15-64) population

metric_14.label: Old-age dependency ratio
metric_14.tooltip: Ratio of old-age (65+) to working age (15-64) population

metric_15.label: Household income
metric_15.tooltip: Estimated based on the 2020 Household Income, Expenditure and Basic Amenities (HIES/BA) Survey data. There may be relatively high standard errors for certain electoral areas.

metric_18.label: Incidence of poverty
metric_18.tooltip: A person or household was classified as poor if their income fell below the 2019 Poverty Line Income.

metric_19.label: Unemployment rate
metric_19.tooltip: Labour force indicators by electoral area were estimated based on 2020 Labour Force Survey data and the estimated population factors for 2020. This data should be used with caution due to relatively high standard errors for certain electoral areas.

metric_22.label: Access to electricity
metric_22.tooltip: Includes both 24-hour supply and intermittent supply

metric_23.label: Access to piped water at home

metric_24.label: Hospitals per 1000 people
metric_24.tooltip: Includes all public and private hospitals in operation as of 1 May 2022. Data on hospitals was sourced from the Ministry of Health Malaysia. Geospatial analysis was conducted by DOSM.

metric_25.label: Health clinics per 1000 people
metric_25.tooltip: Includes all public and private clinics in operation as of 1 May 2022. Data on clinics was sourced from the Ministry of Health Malaysia. Geospatial analysis was conducted by DOSM.

metric_26.label: Schools per 1000 children
metric_26.tooltip: Includes all public schools in operation as of 1 May 2022. Data on schools was sourced from the Ministry of Education. Geospatial analysis was conducted by DOSM.

metric_27.label: Police and fire stations per 1000 people
metric_27.tooltip: Includes police and fire stations in operation as of 1 May 2022. Data on police and fire stations were sourced from the Royal Malaysian Police and the Fire and Rescue Department of Malaysia respectively. Geospatial analysis was conducted by DOSM.

metric_28.label: Grocery stores per 1000 people
metric_28.tooltip: Includes both publicly and privately owned grocery stores. Equivalent to Provision Stores based on the Malaysia Standard Industrial Classification (MSIC) 2008 Ver 1.0.
